page.title: 03THE CHURCHES.
page.content: There is an Anglican church in each of the three villages,{Figheldean, {Fittleton and Netheravon.}There are also two chapels but the one in Figheldean is redundant and used as a meeting room,the other is a Roman Catholic chapel. All the churches and the churchyards are well looked after. Figheldean is dedicated to{St: Michael and all {Angels}and the other two to{All {Saints.} Figheldean Church,built of flint and rubble,dates from 1100. The most unusual feature is the flight of seven steps from the nave to the chancel. There are three bells, two from 1851 and the third 1721. The kneelers were recently made by parishioners and have designs of British birds worked on them.
